items.title: Communications Manager
items.shortDescription: The Royal Cayman Islands Police Service is currently seeking to employ a Communications Manager to coordinate all public relations and communication strategies of the RCIPS.
items.jobDescription:
The Royal Cayman Islands Police Service (RCIPS) is currently seeking to employ a Communications Manager to coordinate all public relations and communication strategies and plans to proactively promote the positive public image and reputation of the RCIPS. The post holder must ensure that public relations and communication strategies and programmes of RCIPS are developed in a manner that has due regard to key trends in public concerns, and relevant professional opinions, and articulates the vision and values of RCIPS, its goals and objectives.

Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Develop and manage communication programmes and strategies from conception through implementation to ensure they are properly researched and planned, to meet agreed objectives.
  • Advise, organise and lead media liaison, crime campaigns, community engagement and initiatives, preparing communication, press releases and news conferences through print, broadcast and social media.
  • Maintain daily liaison with the media as appropriate, responding to telephone and email queries from internal and external stakeholders.
  • Identify, research and advise on trends in public opinion, and implications for communications between the RCIPS and the public.
items.jobRequirements:
• The post holder should have Bachelor’s Degree in communications, public relations, journalism or business administration and
  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a police service or law enforcement agency or
  • An Associate’s Degree with 5-7 years’ relevant work experience.

Other Essential skills and experience include:

  • Strong time management, leadership, communication, interpersonal, analytical, problem solving and technical skills.
  • High degree of technical presentation skills with proven ability to interact and present to diverse groups with varying levels of experience.
  • Sound knowledge and experience in communications and public relations with proven experience developing communication strategies though collaboration with media representatives/agencies.
  • Experience using Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel and Access.
  • Awareness of the operations of the Cayman Islands Government, its personnel, processes and systems.
  • Politically neutral.

Preference will be given to Caymanians.

Applicants must complete the Government Application Form and submit their Resume

with two (2) professional references to:

Chief Human Resources Manager

Royal Cayman Islands Police Service

P.O. Box 909, CAYMAN ISLANDS KY1-1103

items.title: Structural Engineer
items.shortDescription: The position of Structural Engineer will provide viable structural designs and site monitoring of the structural aspects of projects throughout the construction process.
items.jobDescription: The position of Structural Engineer will provide viable structural designs and technical advice, expertise, the provision of documentation relating to structural designs, structural calculations, site investigation and site monitoring of the structural aspects of projects throughout the construction process.
items.jobRequirements: The post holder must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Structural Engineering from a recognized/accredited institution and be a registered (chartered member) engineer of a professional institution of architects either in the US, UK or Canada. A minimum of seven (7) years of relevant, Structural Engineer level experience. Previous work experience within the Caribbean will be considered as an asset. He/she should have knowledge of constructional techniques, building methodologies, codes, and knowledge in the use of BIM software. Additionally, significant and broad experience in structural design / construction of projects and structural engineering in the design of reinforced concrete, steel, masonry, and timber as applied to construction of buildings and structures and the management of all phases of building projects, including client liaison, design, tendering procedures, contract management, construction methods and financial/schedule control is required. A valid Drivers License is required.

items.title: Head of Finance
items.shortDescription: Affinity Recruitment has been engaged by a highly reputable organization in the legal industry to assist in their search for the Head of Finance to join their expanding team.
items.jobDescription:
Affinity Recruitment has been engaged by a highly reputable organization in the legal industry to assist in their search for The Head of Finance to join their fast-paced and expanding team.

Reporting to the Finance & Operations Manager, the successful candidate will primarily focus on the general ledger, accounts payable, management reporting and cash management functions.

Duties:

  • Review and submit statutory, regulatory and management reporting, including budgeting and forecasting;
  • Guide decisions by establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures;
  • Prepare documentation and analysis to respond to internal and external auditor requests;
  • Assist with preparing annual Cayman budget. Assist in setting annual budget targets, lead the departments through the process and prepare the annual financial budget for presentation to the Finance & Operations Manager;
  • Assist with budget objectives by scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions;
  • Collaborate with the Global Finance Team and provide fact-based recommendations which improve profitability, operating efficiency and effectiveness;
  • Prepare special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends;
  • Comply with local legislation; anticipating future legislation; enforcing adherence to requirements; filing financial reports; advising management on needed actions;
  • Fulfill accounting and financial operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees; following up on work results and performance;
  • Perform full range of personnel management responsibilities including performance management; succession planning and coaching of finance team;
  • Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies;
  • Protects operations by keeping financial information and plans confidential.
items.jobRequirements:
• An internationally recognized professional accounting qualification (e.g. ACCA, CA, ACA, CPA or equivalent) with a minimum of four years post qualification;
  • Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles;
  • At least three years of prior management experience with strong managing skills, with the ability to create clear goals, foster accountability, and ownership, while encouraging delegation at appropriate levels;
  • Ability to maintain professional demeanor and positive attitude in a fast paced, continually changing business environment;
  • Strong problem resolution skills and experience in dealing directly with internal clients to manage and meet expectations for delivery of services;
  • Ability to streamline functions and have a passion to learn and grow;
  • Strong knowledge of internal control requirements for transactional processing required;
  • Proven organizational and time management skills, along with a strong attention to detail;
  • Ability to identify and re-mediate internal control deficiencies;
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills;
  • Law firm experience desirable, but not essential;

In return a highly competitive remuneration is on offer commensurate with experience and qualifications, salary in the range of USD $ 110,000 – USD $ 140,000 plus a full range of premium benefits.
